intro: Borreria eritrichoides, commonly known as the Mexican wallflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. It has small, narrow leaves and produces fruit that contains several seeds. Borreria eritrichoides is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
